meanings.definition: Fear or dislike of anything new or unfamiliar.
meanings.sent1: Her neophobia prevented her from trying the new restaurant in town.
meanings.sent2: His neophobia made it challenging for him to adapt to changes in technology.
meanings.sent3: Despite his neophobia, he decided to step out of his comfort zone and attend the event.
meanings.sent4: The neophobia in the community was evident when they resisted implementing new policies.
meanings.sent5: The child's neophobia was so strong that he refused to taste any food he hadn't tried before.

meanings.definition: Reluctance to try new things or take risks.
meanings.sent1: Neophobia can hold individuals back from exploring new opportunities.
meanings.sent2: His neophobia often kept him from participating in adventurous activities.
meanings.sent3: Despite her neophobia, she decided to try the exotic dish at the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The neophobia of the team led to missed chances for innovation.
meanings.sent5: The student's neophobia was evident when he hesitated to join the new club at school.
